Text.name: Text0
Text.content:
Since OpenCms 9.5 XML contents can be edited and added via a JavaScript-API. We call this feature “User generated content”, short UGC. It allows to:

  • Let users generate/edit content without login
  • Add/edit content from the online project
  • Provide completely customized ways to fill and edit content
  • Use client-side validation of content that goes beyond the validation rules in XSDs
  • Build a back-end to an existing form that creates/alters an OpenCms XML content

To use the UGC-JavaScript-API:

  • Add a UGC configuration file to your page and add a formatter for it, that renders the input form
  • Add the JavaScript source file exposing the API to your formatter (via headincludes in the formatter-config)
  • Add some JavaScript calling the API
